EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Soft Drinks} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =51178.3?
EVJ.A: At X =51178.3,the label with the highest density is {Soft Drinks}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 38134? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Soft Drinks}'s peak at {46647},{Bottled Water}'s peak at {83183},{Alcoholic Beverages}'s peak at {56256}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 61890? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Soft Drinks}'s peak at {46647},{Juices}'s peak at {20621},{Kombucha}'s peak at {9617},{Alcoholic Beverages}'s peak at {56256},{Coffee}'s peak at {7207},{Energy Drinks}'s peak at {14715}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Alcoholic Beverages or Coffee?
NC.A: {Alcoholic Beverages} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Energy Drinks or Bottled Water?
NC.A: {Bottled Water} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {2} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Soft Drinks}
